entry.title: Vegetable Chili
entry.content:
No tricky parts to this at all.

Preparation time
about 50 mins
Cooking time
40 minutes on Stove
makes 8 chili
freeze after cooking

Ingredients

  • Chili base
    • 400g green lentils
    • 3 ribs celery, chopped
    • 4 large carrots, chopped
    • 4 cans chopped tomatoes , liquidized if required
    • 3 cans of your favorite beans (one should really be Kidney beans )
  • Seasoning ( to taste)
    • 2 teaspoons turmeric
    • 1 teaspoons of cumin
    • 2 oxo cubes
    • 2 teaspoons mixed spice
    • 1/2 teaspoons black pepper
    • 1/2 teaspoons cayenne pepper

Method

Base Mix

Step 1) Add the lentils to a pan once rinsed and then bring to the boil with 500 ml water and boil for 10 minutes.

Once boiled then leave to simmer for 30 minutes until soft. Best top use Green Lentils as they work really well with Chili as they hold together well.

Step 2) add the chopped the tomatoes to a large pan and liquidize as required.

Step 3) add the chopped carrots and celery

Step 4) add the chopped Onion, I chop mine up in a food processor as I dont like large bits on Onion

Step 5) add all the chopped ingredients along with the cooked Lentils to the large pan

Step 6) add all the Seasoning to the large pan

Step 7) Stir well and cook on a low heat for 10 minutes or so

Step 4) serve with rice or CHIPS!

Item Value per Chili (no Rice)
Calories 317
Protein 20g
Carbohydrates 45g
Fiber 18g
Fat 2g of which 1g is saturated


Clearly you can just increase the proportions to make an even larger batch !
entry.summary: No tricky parts to this at all.

entry.title: Pasties with Swede
entry.content:
The only tricky part of this is the pastry which frankly isnt worth making yourself. Apart from that the rest is really easy.

Preperation time
about 30 mins
Cooking time
30 minutes in a conventional Oven
makes 3 pasties
freeze before cooking

Ingredients

  • Pastry
    • 250g plain flour
    • 1 teaspoon salt
    • 25g lemon juice
    • 15g chia seeds
    • 80g vegetable oil
    • non dairy milk
  • Pastry
    • 100g green lentils
    • 100g of garden peas ( frozen works well)
    • 100g carrots
    • 100g celery
  • Gravy
    • 1 1/2 teaspoons gravy granules
    • 1 vegetable stock cube
    • Glug of port (optional !)
  • Seasoning ( to taste)
    • 1 teaspoons turmeric
    • ½ teaspoon mixed spice
    • ½ teaspoon garlic powder
    • ½ teaspoons of cumin
    • ½ teaspoons of cayenne pepper

Method

Pastry

Step 1) Add the dry ingredients into a bowl and mix well.

Step 2) Add the oil and mix with your hands into a sort of breadcrumb consistency. Then add the lemon and then kneed into a ball and add milk, just enough to make the ball sticky but workable. Dont overkneed the mixture.

Step 3) leave the pastry as a ball in the fridge for 15-20 mins, while you make the filling.

Step 4) Mash the potatoes and Butternut Squash with the Almond milk or you can use margarin

Filling

Step 5) Peel and chop the carrots and chop the onion and celery finely, if you like chunky onion then that can be left bigger.

Step 6) Peel the Swede and Chop into around 1/2cm cubes measure out the frozen peas too.

Step 7) Make the gravy - crumble the veg stock cube and add the gravy granules into around 1 pint, or more if you like. Microwave for 2 mins and stir then microwave for another minute when you are going to add to the mixture.

Step 8) Add all the filling ingredients and seasoning to a pot with the seasoning and the gravy and simmer for around 10 mins. Top tip do not add too much gravy as otherwise the filling will simply leak out of the pastry, you have been warned

Bringing it all together

Step 9) Split the pasty into thirds and roll each third into a ball. Roll out the pastry and add a third of the mixture onto the pastry and draw the sides up. Seal with water or a little milk. You can see by the picture this was a tricky operation in which I failed :-(.

Step 10) cook for around 30 mins or so on around 180 degrees for a fan oven or 200 degrees for a conventional oven. Any left over pasties can be frozen prior to cooking. Serve with loads of Veg and the left over gravy.

Item Value per Pasty
Calories 610
Protein 13g
Carbohydrates 78g
Fiber 9g
Fat 29g of which 4g is saturated

These pasties are very filling and because you can batch make them they are a great thing to pull out of the freezer as and when needed.
entry.summary: The only tricky part of this is the pastry which frankly isnt worth making yourself. Apart from that the rest is really easy.

entry.title: Banana and Date Flapjacks
entry.content:
These are a tasty protein packed sweet treat. They are very easy to make and you can substitute different seeds and nuts as you wish.

Preperation time
about 10 mins
Cooking time
25 minutes in a conventional Oven
makes 10 flapjacks

Ingredients

  • 50g walnuts or any other plain nuts
  • 3 medium bananas
  • 200g rolled oats
  • 200g pitted dates
  • 50g raisins
  • 40g pumpkin seeds
  • 4 teaspoons sugar optional

Method

Step 1) Mash the bananas with a fork and add the dates and oil and mix well.
Step 2) Sire in the oats and the other ingredients, except for the sugar, and mix well, I find using the fork in a mixing bowl works really well much better than a spoon.

Step 3) Add to a tray pressing as you add and sprinkle the sugar over the mixture. Cook for around 25 mins or so on around 170 degrees for a fan oven or 180 degrees for a conventional oven. keep an eye on it while it cooks so you do not get burnt flapjacks.

Step 3) Once it is cooked, leave for 10 mins or so until a little cooler and score the mixture into slices. Then enjoy !

Item Value per Flapjack
Calories 269
Protein 5g
Carbohydrates 41g
Fiber 6g
Fat 9.4g of which 1.6g is saturated

Try experimenting with different nuts and seeds, the sugar sprinkled on top also give a crunch and the illusion of more sweetness.
entry.summary: These are a tasty protein packed sweet treat. They are very easy to make and you can substitute different seeds and nuts as you wish.

entry.title: Butternut Squash Pizza
entry.content:
This is easy to make and only has a few readily available ingredients.

Preperation time
about 10 mins
waiting time, about 2-4 hours
Cooking time
17 minutes in a conventional Oven
makes 1 pizza

Ingredients

  • 150g Butternut Squash
  • 1 can Black Beans or your beans of choice
  • 125g of Garden Peas
  • your choice of vegetables for the topping, I used Carrot, Broccoli, Cauliflower and Courgetti - total of 300g ish
  • your choice of milk, around 50ml, for the Butternut Squash, I use Almond
  • Pizza Dough
    • 200g Plain Flour
    • 1/2 teaspoon Dried Yeast
    • 1 teaspoon of Chia Seeds
    • 200mg of Water
    • some more Plain Flour to help kneading

Method

Step 1) I made this manually, you can us a mixer with a dough hook but as I was only making one manual worked well. Put the flour in a mixing bowl and add the yeast. Dry mix before adding the water. I would warm the water first and only add 3/4 of it and start to mix with a spoon or your hand. When the dough is of a wet ball consistency you can start to kneed it.

Step 2) When kneading the dough you are after a springiness to the dough so that if you press it in it springs back. Use some plain flour as the base to knead on otherwise it will simply stick to the chopping board or worksurface. This takes around 10 minutes of kneading. Once you have that spring in the dough cover with a cloth and leave in a warm place for 2-4 hours. The dough will get around 30-40% bigger after this time.

Step 3) Whilst waiting for the dough to rise you can prepare the butter knut Squash and the other vegitables. For the Squash remove the seeds and peal the outside. then cut into around 1/2 inch cubes. Cover with water and bring to the boil then let simmer for around 10 min or until the Squash is soft. You can then mash it with your choice of milk.

Step 4) once the dough has risen then knock it back by simply giving it a thump and it will sort of delate. You can then stretch it out. You can use a roller but I found that just pulling it around a bit seemed to work ok. I cannot say mine was round though !

Step 5) spread the Butternut Squash on the Pizza base. I used the back of a spoon but you can also use a fork to give it some texture.

Step 6) add the Beans and Vegetables. I added the Vegetables raw but you can seam them a little before if you prefer. if you use a steamer then I would suggest steaming them for 1/2 the time you would usually as otherwise they will go a bit limp in the oven.

Step 7) Put in the oven - 180 Degrees and keep an eye on it as the vegetables can easily burn. One thing you need to do is to make sure the middle of the dough is as thin as the rest of it as otherwise it wont cook properly. Or you can make the Butternut Squash a bit thinner in the middle.

Item Value per 1/2 Pizza
Calories 610
Protein 25g
Carbohydrates 115g
Fiber 16g
Fat 4g of which 1 is saturated

The end result is a little variable, you can put some Vegetarian cheese on top if you prefer.
entry.summary: This is easy to make and only has a few readily available ingredients.

entry.title: Butternut Squash Pie
entry.content:
This is easy to make and only has a few readily available ingredients.

Preperation time
about 10 mins
Cooking time
30 minutes in a conventional Oven
makes 3 pies
freeze before cooking

Ingredients

  • 120g green lentils
  • 1 can cannellini beans or your beans of choice
  • 125g of garden peas
  • 175g carrots
  • 600g white potatoes for the toppings
  • 150g Butternut Squash
  • 200mg Almond milk for mash topping
  • 1 vegetarian stock cube
  • seasoning ( to taste)
    • 1 ½ teaspoons gravy granules
    • ½ teaspoon garlic powder
    • 1 ½ teaspoons of cumin
    • ½ teaspoons of cayenne pepper

Method

Step 1) Cook lentils – cover with water and bring to the boil then let simmer for around 20 mins. Boil potatoes for around the same time along with 50g of the Butternut Squash

Step 2) Make the gravy - crumble the veg stock cube and add the gravy granules into around 1 pint, or more if you like. Microwave for 2 mins and stir then microwave for another minute when you are going to add to the lentils.

Step 3) Add beans - once the lentils are cooked add the beans, I always drain first because they come with preservative water in most tins which you do not need.

Step 4) Mash the potatoes and Butternut Squash with the Almond milk or you can use margarine if you wish.

Step 5) Add carrots, peas and the rest of the Butternut Squash - Chop the carrots and Butternut Squash finely, no need to peel the carrots just a quick scrub and top and tail them add to lentils, add the garden peas, these can be straight from frozen.

Step 6) Seasoning - add the seasoning to the mixture and stir well, feel free to add different amounts and types.

Step 7) decant into pie containers or use cookwear or thing that will be an appropriate oven/freezer proof container. Add the lids and score the top with a fork ( to get crispy bits).

Step 7) cook for around 40 mins or so on around 180 degrees for a fan oven or 200 degrees for a conventional oven. Any left over pies can be frozen prior to cooking. Serve with loads of Veg and the left over gravy.

Item Value per Pie
Calories 399
Protein 16g
Carbohydrates 78g
Fiber 15g
Fat 2g of which 0 is saturated

These pie’s are very filling and because you can batch make them they are a good thing to pull out of the freezer as and when needed.
entry.summary: This is easy to make and only has a few readily available ingredients.

entry.title: Bean Burgers
entry.content:
This is very easy to make and only has a few readily available ingredients.

Preparation time
about 10 mins
Cooking time
30 minutes in a conventional Oven or 10 minutes frying
makes 4 pies
freeze before cooking

Ingredients

  • 4 cans of beans of your choice I use Black Eyed Beans, red Kidney Beans, Brorlotti beans and Butter Beans
  • 1 red Onion
  • 1 Flax Egg ( 2 desert spoons of Flaxseed 6 desert spoons of Hot Water
  • seasoning ( to taste)
    • <li 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil </li?
    • 3 teaspoon garlic powder
    • 3 teaspoons of cumin
    • 1 teaspoon of cayenne pepper

Method

Step 1) Make the Flax Egg, this is simply either flaxseed or chai seed and water, I use 1 dessertspoon of flaxseed and 3 dessertspoons of water. Add boiling water to the flaxseed and mix well. then leave to cool..

Step 2) Chop the Onion and then pulse in a food mixer. I am not very keen on Onions so I make this really fine but you may like it chunky !

Step 3) Add the beans and pulse or mix until you have either a fine or coarse bean mixture. My food processor seemed to produce a mixture of both consistencies

Step 5) Seasoning - add the seasoning to the mixture and stir well, feel free to add different amounts and types. the stiring didnt work well in the food mixer so I put the ingredients in a bowl and sired by hand.

Step 6) Make the burgers by hand, to get the same about per burger I used 2 large dessertspoons of mixture per burger and then formed by hand.

Step 7) cook for around 30 mins or so in the oven or fry for 5 minutes each side with a little vegetable oil.

Item Value per burger
Calories 139
Protein 9g
Carbohydrates 17g
Fiber 8g
Fat 2g of which 0 is saturated

These burgers are packed with beans, the clue is in the name ! Batch make them they are a good thing to pull out of the freezer as and when needed.
entry.summary: This is very easy to make and only has a few readily available ingredients.

entry.title: Cottage Pie
entry.content:
This is easy to make and only has a few readily available ingredients.

Preperation time
about 10 mins
Cooking time
30 minutes in a conventional Oven
makes 4 pies
freeze before cooking

Ingredients

  • 120g green lentils
  • 1 can cannellini beans or your beans of choice
  • 1 can Borlotti beans or your beans of choice
  • 125g of garden peas
  • 175g carrots
  • 700g white potatoes for the toppings
  • 200mg Almond milk if using potatoes for topping
  • 1 vegetarian stock cube
  • seasoning ( to taste)
    • 1 ½ teaspoons gravy granules
    • ½ teaspoon garlic powder
    • 1 ½ teaspoons of cumin
    • ½ teaspoons of cayenne pepper

Method

Step 1) Cook lentils – cover with water and bring to the boil then let simmer for around 20 mins. Boil potatoes for around the same time.

Step 2) Make the gravy - crumble the veg stock cube and add the gravy granules into around 1 pint, or more if you like. Microwave for 2 mins and stir then microwave for another minute when you are going to add to the lentils.

Step 3) Add beans - once the lentils are cooked add the beans, I always drain first because they come with preservative water in most tins which you do not need. If you are using potatoes then mash these with the Almond milk or you can use margarine if you wish.

Step 4) Add carrots and peas - Chop carrots finely, no need to peel them just a quick scrub and top and tail them add to lentils, add the garden peas, these can be straight from frozen.

Step 5) Seasoning - add the seasoning to the mixture and stir well, feel free to add different amounts and types.

Step 6) decant into pie containers or use cookwear or thing that will be an appropriate oven/freezer proof container. Add the lids and score the top with a fork ( to get crispy bits).

Step 7) cook for around 30 mins or so on around 180degrees for a fan oven or 200degrees for a conventional oven. Any left over pies can be frozen prior to cooking. Serve with loads of Veg and the left over gravy.

Item Value per Pie
Calories 358
Protein 16g
Carbohydrates 65g
Fiber 15g
Fat 2g of which 0.5 is saturated

These pie’s are very filling and because you can batch make them they are a good thing to pull out of the freezer as and when needed.
entry.summary: This is easy to make and only has a few readily available ingredients.

entry.title: Lentil and Bean Pies
entry.content:
This is easy to make and only has a few readily available ingredients. There are two options but the one with the potato top isn’t really a pie and more resembles a cottage pie, still delicious though!

Preperation time
about 10 mins
Cooking time
30 minutes in a conventional Oven
makes 6 pies
freeze before cooking

Ingredients

  • 120g green lentils
  • 1 can cannellini beans or your beans of choice
  • 1 can Borlotti beans or your beans of choice
  • 125g of garden peas
  • 175g carrots
  • Shortcrust pastry enough for 6 lids ( 1 pack of easy roll 375g)
  • 200mg Almond milk if using potatoes for topping
  • 1 vegetarian stock cube
  • seasoning
    • 1 ½ teaspoons gravy granules
    • ½ teaspoon garlic powder
    • 1 ½ teaspoons of cumin
    • ½ teaspoons of cayenne pepper

Method

Step 1) Cook lentils – cover with water and bring to the boil then let simmer for around 20 mins.

Step 2) Make the gravy - crumble the veg stock cube and add the gravy granules into around 1 pint, or more if you like. Microwave for 2 mins and stir then microwave for another minute when you are going to add to the lentils.

Step 3) Add beans - once the lentils are cooked add the beans, I always drain first because they come with preservative water in most tins which you do not need. If you are using potatoes then mash these with the Almond milk or you can use margarine if you wish.

Step 4) Add carrots and peas - Chop carrots finely, no need to peel them just a quick scrub and top and tail them add to lentils, add the garden peas, these can be straight from frozen.

Step 5) Seasoning - add the seasoning to the mixture and stir well, feel free to add different amounts and types.

Step 6) decant into pie containers or use cookwear or thing that will be an appropriate oven/freezer proof container. Add the lids and decorate with whatever design you wish.

Step 7) cook for around 30 mins or so on around 180degrees for a fan oven or 200degrees for a conventional oven. Any left over pies can be frozen prior to cooking. Serve with loads of Veg and the left over gravy.

Nutrients

Item Value per Pie
Calories 406
Protein 13g
Carbohydrates 42g
Fiber 10g
Fat 19g of which 7 is saturated

These pie’s are very filling and because you can batch make them they are a good thing to pull out of the freezer as and when needed.
entry.summary: This is easy to make and only has a few readily available ingredients. There are two options but the one with the potato top isn’t really a pie and more resembles a cottage pie, still delicious though!
